<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Charlatan](/Feats.aspx?ID=1178) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 104 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5)

</column>

---

You’ve learned to mimic the abilities of spellcasters by studying their flourishes and words. When you activate a magic item to generate a spell effect, attempt a Deception check. If you succeed against an onlooker’s Perception DC, to that onlooker, you appear to [Cast that Spell](/Actions.aspx?ID=72) instead. Onlookers who successfully [Recognize the Spell](/Feats.aspx?ID=834) realize you used a magic item, though those who later successfully [Identify the Magic](/Actions.aspx?ID=24) still can’t determine that the source of the effect was a magic item.
name: Charlatan
